وولے سوینکا نائجیریا کے ڈراما نگار ہیں: Wole Soyinka Nigerian playwright Wole Soyinka nationality

1934-Present Day Nigerian Wole Soyinka is an award winning writer, poet, playwright and recipient of the 1986 Nobel Prize in Literature. After graduating from the Government College in Ibadan, Nigeria, Soyinka studied drama at the University of Leeds during the 1950s.
Wole Soyinka Nigerian playwright Wole Soyinka nationality

Wole Soyinka was born in Abeokuta, Nigeria. His father was a priest in the Anglican Church and principal of a school. His mother owned a store and was active within the women's liberation movement. His family belongs to the Yoruba people, whose culture has influenced Soyinka's works.
وولے سوینکا نائجیریا کے شاعر ہیں: Is Wole Soyinka a poet from Nigeria? Wole Soyinka Nigerian poet

Wole Soyinka (born 13 July 1934) is a Nigerian author, best known as a playwright and poet. He has written three novels, ten collections of short stories, seven poetry collections, twenty five plays and five memoirs.
Is Wole Soyinka a poet from Nigeria? Wole Soyinka Nigerian poet
